block.p: FURNITURE BRANDS INTERNATIONAL INC., St. Louis, the biggest United States maker of residential furniture, said demand for its products slowed this month and it might have to close factories.
HOME DEPOT INC., Atlanta, the world's largest home-improvement retailer, with about 1,000 stores, will add stores in Canada and Puerto Rico.

DELPHI AUTOMOTIVE SYSTEMS CORP., Troy, Mich., the world's largest auto parts maker, will move most of its acquisitions staff to its Michigan headquarters.

MAPINFO CORP., Troy, N.Y., a maker of software used to create maps, said it would split its stock 3 shares for 2 on Sept. 28 for shareholders as of Sept. 8 and buy back as much as $5 million of its common stock.
